body.p:
I duly received your returned favor
of 3rd inst. the package of Books also came safely
to hand and have been distributed as per directions.
I have an understanding with ? to return
to me any Occidents not delivered. They for now
have been returned to him by his carriers. No delay
occurred this time in distributing the work and I
trust hereafter all will go on smoothly & without
delay.

I have the package of Books from Charleston, it
was with H. Barillien. Book Seller No. 29 Broadway.
If I do not have an opportunity to send it on privately
within a few days, I will send it by express.
I have not yet seen B. Cohen but will do so the first
time I go that way, and collect your bill against him
It affords now much pleasure to furnish you with a
letter of introduction to Mr Lane of the Ledger (which
letter I enclose) and hope it may be of service to you.
You will find, Mr Lane a very clean man, although plain
and old fashioned, but not, as learned as your goodself
He is no bigot on Religious matters; and I think feels disposed
to let even ? enjoy their own opinions on that subject.
I have not seen the articles you refer to, as published

under dates of 18th & 24th Feby. as I seldom see the
Ledger. I hope you will soon succeed in silencing
all your foes.

Please say to Mr Cozens the family left by Mr Thorp
are getting along very comfortably and the children by
his first wife are all married except Delia, the youngest
and all remain with their step mother except Charlotte
& Charles. Charlotte did not marry will no a worldly
point and has now got ahead any I have seen her
but once for 3 or 9 years & then she looked old & careless
she has I believe only one child, a Daughter. Charles
has been married several years, but has no children
having lost by death the only he ever had; last summer
he got possession of his fathers Stove & Stock at the sale of his
effects for a mere song and is now carrying on the
stove business with the assistance of Charlottes Husband
I do not think he will ever make a rich man—
Athinaus? is married to a very good, young man and
is doing very well, she has one child only, a Boy.
Sarah was married on Thursday last, to a man
who is some 10 or 12 years her senior, by profession a Bookkeeper
on a sallary of $1200 pr an but said to be an excellent man
Sarah is an excellent girl and was very much beloved by her
step mother. Delia is also a good girl and in manner &
appearance decidedly the flower of the family. She is very
lady like & easy in her manners & has been well educated
Mrs Thorp deserves great credit for the care she has taken
of the family and for the manner in which she has brought

up the girls, and for keeping the family together since Mr
Thorps death as she has had to depend on her own means
to do so, Mr Thorp having left nothing of his own in fact
not enough to pay his debts & Charles will do nothing
for his sisters, not even to the extent of a wedding present to
Sarah. However I think they will do very well without him
at all events I do not intend to let them suffer.

Many thanks to Mrs Cozens & yourself for the kind solicitude
expressed by you both for my health And which has greatly
improved since my last. And I now have hopes that it
will not be advisable for me to take the southern tour
heretofore contemplated.

With kindest regards to Mrs Cozens & the girls, and
best wishes for the health & prosperity of all
